intro: Threlkeldia diffusa, commonly known as the silky senna, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it has a climbing habit with tendrils. Threlkeldia diffusa thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in rainforests. Its flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
